IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The Katharine Hepburn Cultural Arts Center exists to present a diverse repertoire of cultural and performing arts, to provide educational opportunities in the arts, and to be lasting legacy for America's iconic actress.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The Katharine Hepburn Cultural Arts Center exists to present a diverse repertoire of cultural and performing arts, to provide educational opportunities in the arts, and to be lasting legacy for America's iconic actress.
IRS990.Desc: Over 300 events were produced and offered to the general public. These events showcased the arts including local and regional theater, livestreams, concerts, dance, film, lectures, art exhibits, and other artistic endeavors.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Use of facility space for local artists and other groups to stage performances open to the general public or for special events.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part III, Line 1a: If organization elected under SFAS 116 to not report are, historical treasures, o
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization has museum where it displays memorabilia from its own collection and items on loan from owners. In accordance with GAAP, collection items are not capitalized. GAAP provides that such donations need not be recognized if they are added to collections that are held for public examination, education or research in the futherance of public service rather than financial gain; and are subject to a policy that requires the proceeds from the sales of collection items to be used to acquire other collection items, the direct care of existing items, or both.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part III, Line 4: Description of organization's collections and how it furthers its purpose.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization has museum where it displays memorabilia from its own collection and items on loan from owners. In accordance with GAAP, collection items are not capitalized. GAAP provides that such donations need not be recognized if they are added to collections that are held for public examination, education or research in the futherance of public service rather than financial gain; and are subject to a policy that requires the proceeds from the sales of collection items to be used to acquire other collection items, the direct care of existing items, or both.

The Organization recognizes the tax benefit from uncertain tax positions when it is more-likely-then-not the position will be sustained upon examination by taxing authorities. The Organization had no uncertain tax positions that qualify for either recognition or disclosure in the financial statements. In the normal course of business, the Organizations tax filings are subject to examination by federal and state taxing authorities. The Organizations tax returns for the last three years remain open for examination.
